medical_history.chief_complaint: Symptomatic hypocalcemia in individual III-2 presenting with headaches, decreased energy, muscle cramps, post-exertional laryngeal stridor, diplopia, and visual blurring.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Presented at 6 years and 6 months with acute symptoms. Duration of muscle cramps and headaches has persisted since onset. The patient had episodes of renal colic leading to nephrocalcinosis and urolithiasis at 7 years and 4 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of nephrocalcinosis and urolithiasis; intermittent hoarseness described by the mother.
medical_history.family_history: The father has a history of nephrolithiasis. Maternal grandfather and grandmother reported no kidney stone history. An uncertain report of kidney stones exists for the paternal grandfather.
